{"_id":"51afb4642b3fc98e2f000002","bongo_":{"constructorName":"JDiscussion"},"slug":"backbone-nested-models","title":"Backbone - nested models","slug_":"backbone-nested-models","originId":"50ef44be5152a79d2c00002a","originType":"JAccount","group":"koding","meta":{"modifiedAt":"2013-06-05T21:57:56.614Z","likes":0,"createdAtEpoch":1370469476,"createdAt":"2013-06-05T21:57:56.000Z"},"body":"Question - how did you tackle backbone nested models / collections?

I started by overriding the parse method of my parent model and creating an additional collection, but this introduced tight coupling / some funky things happening when trying to use get / set on inner model attributes.

Eventually i found http://backbonerelational.org/ and realised this solved my problem, however (and slightly due to my OCD kicking in) i'd love to be able to use "vanilla" backbone to solve this.

I would love to hear how other people have tackled this.","attachments":[],"repliesCount":0,"opinionCount":3,"counts":{"following":0,"followers":3},"tags":[{"counts":{"tagged":0,"post":1,"developer":16,"following":0,"followers":5},"title":"Backbone.js","slug":"backbone.js","group":"koding","meta":{"createdAtEpoch":1357669234,"createdAt":"2013-01-08T18:20:34.000Z"},"_id":"50ec6372cc7ed6e55f000bc0","name":"JTag","id":"50ec6372cc7ed6e55f000bc0","relationType":"tag","bongo_":{"constructorName":"JTag"}},{"counts":{"tagged":0,"post":162,"developer":810,"following":0,"followers":5865},"title":"JavaScript","slug_":"javascript-2","slug":"javascript","group":"koding","body":"JavaScript (sometimes abbreviated JS) is a prototype-based scripting language that is dynamic, weakly typed and has first-class functions.
